page.title: 06TOURISM
page.content: {Cockbury Court}is a collection of 7 self-catering holiday cottages set in their own grounds. Originally farm buildings on the estate of nearby Sudeley Castle some of them,including a tithe barn, date from the 16th & 17th centuries. More recently the hamlet of Cockbury was a millionaire's private retreat until it was taken over for its present purpose in 1976. Now the proprietor,Mr.M.Blanchard,welcomes guests from all over the world but mainly Australia, Canada and the U.S.A. There is an ornamental pond with large gold-fish as well as a swimming pool.The doors of the tithe barn are always open during the Summer to let nesting swallows and house martins fly in and out.
